summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a corrections officer (OFFICER 1) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, conducted on August 16, 2019, regarding the circumstances surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The officer describes his shift, the cell counts, and his interactions with Epstein. The interview ends when the officer requests a lawyer after being shown a picture of an unidentified individual.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The officer states he once fed him and that Epstein was grateful.

connections.description: OFFICER 1 was the corrections officer responsible for the unit where Epstein was housed. He once fed Epstein when he had not received a meal.
Worked together on the 12am inmate count. OFFICER 2 later checked on OFFICER 1 during the shift.
Assisted OFFICER 1 with the 3am and 5am inmate counts in the Special Housing Unit.
THOMAS relieved OFFICER 1 during his shift to give him a break.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: FBI Interview of Corrections Officer
events.description: OFFICER 1 was interviewed by FBI and OIG agents regarding the circumstances of Epstein's death. The interview was terminated when OFFICER 1 requested a lawyer after being shown a picture.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: OFFICER 1 was the sole officer in the locked-down Special Housing Unit (10 South) during the overnight shift when Jeffrey Epstein was found dead.
OFFICER 1 insisted on having a partner for inmate counts to ensure a 'double staff count' and to see 'breathing flesh.' He was assisted by OFFICER 2 and Officer NOEL for the 3am and 5am counts.
The interview was abruptly ended when OFFICER 1 requested a lawyer after being shown a picture of an unidentified individual.
OFFICER 1 voluntarily stated, 'I want to be clear, I never brought stuff into the jail or allowed stuff in. I never did that,' after requesting a lawyer.
The FBI seized OFFICER 1's cell phone pursuant to a search warrant, but he refused to provide his passcode to investigators.
